questions.label: Which tag sets bold text ?
questions.answer: <string> or <b>

questions.label: What does CSS mean ?
questions.answer: Cascading Style Sheets

questions.label: What is CSS used for ?
questions.answer: To add style to web documents.

questions.label: How to make a div take all the available width in its container block ?
questions.answer: It is automatic

questions.label: What does relative positioning allow (position: relative) ?
questions.answer: It allows to shift an element A from its ‘normal’ position.

questions.label: With which CSS 2.1 property can you round the corners of a block (as long as the browser understands it) ?
questions.answer: None. This is only possible in CSS 3 with ‘border-radius’.

questions.label: How to target the first 4 elements of a ‘li’ list?
questions.answer: li:nth-child(-n+4)

questions.label: What is the official prefix for Opera properties ?
How to target all the links on the page except those containing the string “codeworks” ?
questions.answer: a:not([href*=“codeworks”])

questions.label: How can we add the value of a variable in a string ?
questions.answer: By using the template string (`string ${var}`) or by using the + operator.

questions.label: What is a callback ?
questions.answer: It is a function passed as a parameter to another function, which will be called with the result to be able to react to it.

questions.label: What does NaN mean ?
questions.answer: Not A Number

questions.label: How to find the length of the string ?
questions.answer: String.length

questions.label: How to return a random number between 0 and 1 ?
questions.answer: Math.random()

questions.label: Which function is used to delay the execution of an order ?
questions.answer: 2 methods to call when the promise is resolved (resolve ()) or rejected (reject ()).

questions.label: what are the parameters that can take the function that we pass to the creation of a promise ? (new Promise(executor)).
questions.answer: 2 methods to call when the promise is resolved (resolve ()) or rejected (reject ()).

questions.label: What happens on setState() call ?
questions.answer: It replaces actual component state with the one passed as a parameter. It allows React to compare the 2 versions.

questions.label: What does shouldComponentUpdate do ?
questions.answer: This is a lifecycle method that tell React if the component should be updated after the last state modification. It allows optimizations

questions.label: What is the key attribute in lists ?
questions.answer: The keys are list elements id. It helps React to spot it to update it or remove it from the DOM

questions.label: What are the 3 parts that define a Vue component ?
questions.answer: Template, style, script.

questions.label: How do you pass information from a parent component to a child component ?
questions.answer: With props

questions.label: Can a constructor be Private ?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.label: What is JIT ?
questions.answer: Just-In-Time compilation. Its goal is to improve the performance of the bytecode execution according to the real needs when using a program (compilation of the bytecode in native code).

questions.label: What are the new Java 8 features ?
questions.answer: Lambdas, Streams, Optional, API Date.

questions.label: How can a garbage collection be triggered ?
questions.answer: We can’t directly. You can only do System.gc() to notify the garbage collector that you would like to do it but nothing obliges it to do so.

questions.label: What is an anonymous class ?
questions.answer: A class that is defined at the moment of instantiation of an object.

questions.label: What is a RuntimeException ?
questions.answer: An exception that the compiler does not need to check.

questions.label: What is a HashMap ?
questions.answer: Set of unordered (key, value), complexity in O(1) for search and insertion.

questions.label: Can one interface extend another interface ?
questions.answer: Yes
